results.content:
I had a good experience as the course delivered what is promised in the "What you'll learn" section of the course page.  I could code along and get the expected result without any hitch.  I also got to know about UIkit and StackBlitz.  Two links are provided in case we get stuck to compare our code with:  a GitHub page which shows the changes done to the files in that particular lesson and another to StackBlitz online IDE where we can not only compare our code with that of Irek's but also can also make changes to the code and run it.

Thank you, Irek, and my Best Wishes for all your future courses and projects!

response.content: Thank you for a very kind review. I’m glad you liked the course!
response.content_html: Thank you for a very kind review. I’m glad you liked the course!

response.content:
I'm sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with this course. I put in quite a bit of effort to make it under an hour so that students spend their precious time on learning a particular skill at any given point of the course instead of listening to me going on on some general web dev topics. Perhaps, there is a way I could make the intro video more explicit about the content of this course. That would be my action item.

In the meantime, please, don't hesitate to take advantage of the Udemy 30-Day Money-Back Guarantee program and refund your purchase if you don't feel like keeping the access to this course will be useful to you. 

I wish you all the luck, and thanks for your feedback!
